title: Knowledge Check

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of ROS 2 in robotics development?
options: To provide a hardware platform for robots
To serve as a communication framework between robot components
To replace all existing robot software
To act as a robot simulation environment
questions.explanation: ROS 2 (Robot Operating System 2) serves as a middleware framework that provides services such as hardware abstraction, device drivers, libraries, and message-passing between different robot components.

questions.text: Which of the following is a key feature of ROS 2 compared to ROS 1?
questions.explanation: ROS 2 uses DDS (Data Distribution Service) as its underlying middleware, providing better real-time performance, fault tolerance, and language independence compared to ROS 1's custom TCPROS/UDPROS implementations.

questions.text: What does DDS stand for in the context of ROS 2?
questions.explanation: DDS (Data Distribution Service) is the underlying middleware technology that ROS 2 uses for communication between nodes, providing reliable message delivery and real-time performance.

instructions: Select the best answer for each question. You can review your answers after submission.
